alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 3:50AM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations mainly 6 to 12 inches. Higher amounts of 13 to 16 inches are possible for areas northwest of a line from Elwood to Saint Paul to Fullerton. Winds will average 15 to 25 MPH with highest gusts of 30 to 35 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly tonight. This will mainly be a snow event for areas from the Tri Cities north and west. A narrow swath of ice accumulations of a tenth to around a quarter of an inch with lower snowfall amounts of 3 to 7 inches are expected further southeast from Phillips County Kansas northeastward into Webster, Clay, and York Counties in Nebraska. * WHERE...Portions of south central Nebraska and Phillips County in Kansas. * WHEN...Until midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will worsen throughout the day. Lingering travel impacts into at least Thursday morning are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The greatest confidence in heavy snowfall is for areas north and west of the Tri-Cities. Confidence in snowfall amounts decrease further southeast where snow mixes with sleet and freezing rain.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
